alert.note: Alert for Lee (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 09 at 6:19PM EDT until September 09 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Lee County in southwestern Virginia... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 618 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Pennington Gap, or 7 miles north of Jonesville, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Jonesville, Pennington Gap, St. Charles, and Dryden. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail, damaging wind, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
